answers.answer: Hello.Your finger numbness could be related to the diabetes. Diabetic neuropathy starts with fingers and toes and then slowly spreads to other parts. Please make sure you keep the blood sugars under control.The pain in the lower back could be due to a lumbar disc problem. Please get an orthopedic surgeon's opinion.Regards

question: I am 57 years of age and a Diabetic on Insulin.Two weeks ago I experienced a pain in my lower back and buttocks so severe, that I could only articulate the pain as having someone stab me in the butt.I also experienced numbness in my fingers on my right hand.Doctor took x-rays, told me it was Arthritis.Is there anything else that could cause such horrific pain?ProstateKidneysSciaticaCancerHe gave me Vicodin, could this be my fate for the rest of my life?Help!
title: weakness in right leg
